      </style><div class="didomi-popup-view" tabindex="-1" role="document" style="outline: none;"><div class="didomi-popup-notice-logo-container"><img class="didomi-popup-notice-logo" alt="Logo" src="https://shared.mediahuis.be/logos/indo/v3/brand-main.svg"></div><div class="didomi-popup-notice-text-container"><div class="didomi-popup-notice-text"><p><h4>Cookies and data processing on The Irish Independent</h4><br><p>
Mediahuis (‘we’) and <a onclick="Didomi.preferences.show(&quot;vendors&quot;)">partners</a> use technologies such as cookies to store and access (personal) data – online identifiers (e.g., IP address, sign-in ID), non-precise location and information about your browser, operating system, device as well as insights into your use of this domain – on your device for the following purposes:
</p><ul>
<li>Advertising and content measurement, audience insights and product development;</li>
<li>Personalised content;</li>
<li>Personalised ads; and</li>
<li>Social media.</li>
</ul>
<p></p>
<p>
If you allow such use, click "Agree and close". If you do not want to allow all purposes, select "Learn More".  You can change your preferences at any time in your privacy settings. We will share your privacy preferences – for which purposes and partners you provided consent - with our <a onclick="Didomi.preferences.show(&quot;vendors&quot;)">partners</a>.
</p>
<p>
Would you like more explanation about our use of your data? Read our <a href=" https://www.mediahuis.ie/privacystatement/">privacy policy</a> and <a href=" https://www.mediahuis.ie/cookiepolicy/">cookie policy</a>. More information on the use of your data by our partners you find <a onclick="Didomi.preferences.show(&quot;vendors&quot;)">here</a>.

            </div>
            
        <!--[END-widgetgroup-widget]  595efeea-1c2e-4677-b601-ef2bd2c59154 -->    
    
         <!--[START-widgetgroup-widget]  b3d8ea3b-ff90-4b32-b9cd-ef950cc6ef8e -->
        

        <style>.hr1 { border-top: 1px solid; margin: 32px 0; color: #e8e8e8; }</style>
<hr class="hr1">


        <!--[END-widgetgroup-widget]  b3d8ea3b-ff90-4b32-b9cd-ef950cc6ef8e -->    
    
    
</section></div><!--[END-block-widget] f7fe799f-0559-44c2-bd63-b70dbe17e4d8 --><!--[START-block-widget]  1c796a67-9a39-46bb-aae9-22a8ff7d4187 -->

data-testid="plus-icon"></div><h4 class="indo-17abbc75_root indo-17abbc75_heading5 indo-7eeed105_none indo-ea190c2_primary indo-35512234_medium indo-d382f4d9_marginbottom0 indo-d382f4d9_marginleft0 indo-d382f4d9_marginright0 indo-d382f4d9_margintop0 indo-c667e437_inherit" data-testid="title" data-vr-headline="true"><span>‘He’s an even more dangerous animal now… he’s defying the laws of physics’ – How do you to stop TJ Reid?</span></h4></div></div></div></a></li></ul></div></div></section>

            
            </div>
            
        <!--[END-widgetgroup-widget]  b140b260-03e6-4b6e-bab3-5cdbcc583f1c -->    
    
         <!--[START-widgetgroup-widget]  b3d8ea3b-ff90-4b32-b9cd-ef950cc6ef8e -->
        

        <style>.hr1 { border-top: 1px solid; margin: 32px 0; color: #e8e8e8; }</style>
<hr class="hr1">

        <!--[END-widgetgroup-widget]  fd6cac7e-8229-4896-b0a6-ae13a9b546a8 -->

                <section class="indo-ddd60156_paddingbottom0 indo-ddd60156_paddingtop0 indo-8e1bcfad_bordertop" data-testid="article-teaser-list-widget" opinion","label":null},"relativeUrl":"/opinion/comment/ian-odoherty-if-hate-speech-bill-becomes-law-well-all-end-up-in-court-for-voicing-our-opinion/a579299552.html","webcmsId":"A579299552","articleType":"article","title":"Ian O’Doherty: If hate-speech bill becomes law, we’ll all end up in court for voicing our opinion","subLabel":"","premium":true,"intro":[{"p":"Monday was April Fool’s Day, when people traditionally play pranks on each other. It’s a rather archaic tradition. When was the last time someone tried to prank you? I exclude the people of Scotland from that question. They suffer under the soft tyranny of the SNP and their even more unfathomable coalition partners, the Scottish Green Party. Monday symbolised perhaps the greatest prank any government has ever played on its own people. It has now ratified the insane hate-crime act, which will see anyone accused of “hate speech” – by anyone who doesn’t like hearing opinions that differ from their own – facing the prospect of prosecution by the Scottish police. Under this legislation, anyone who is accused of being “mean” or of “misgendering” a man who identifies as a woman can potentially end up in prison. Their lives and careers could be destroyed. It has inflamed controversy because some feminists, and those who believe biological facts hold a greater value than opinions, will be criminalised. This puts them on a collision course with transgender people, who generally use labels for their gender rather than their assigned sex at birth. Scotland’s first minister Humza Yousaf has claimed, in its defence, that the new law would deal with a “rising tide of hatred”. He says anybody who makes a vexatious complaint or one without merit can also be tackled by the police. JK Rowling waged a long battle against the hate-crime bill. She has crusaded against what she sees as tyrannical new structures against freedom of expression. Rowling has argued that “freedom of speech and belief” would be at an end if what she sees as accurate descriptions of biological sex were outlawed. She has now openly challenged Scottish police to arrest her under the new act after writing a series of posts on social media calling some trans women men."}],"images":[{"url":"https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","id":"IMG:520bffee","sourceSets":[{"height":80,"key":"xsmall","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/WQ-vfdXdAe-BVsXIj5xPHgJX8oI=/0x97:531x451/120x80/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":120},{"height":107,"key":"small","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/YEdliDJUro4UPvkMk56LXaVcGio=/0x97:531x451/160x107/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":160},{"height":160,"key":"smallMobile","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/CA6Y3_WC5p7lE_p9cUKulRZhj7k=/0x97:531x451/240x160/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":240},{"height":213,"key":"medium","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/BH3bBHfbDn_DOJ_CFpIL0O2MrYs=/0x97:531x451/320x213/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":320},{"height":427,"key":"large","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/O1GyDMD5iPtO8Bp6133URBppuvE=/0x97:531x451/640x427/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":640},{"height":640,"key":"xlarge","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/6NWg7eOu_E_2pGyfEJO4ripnkSo=/0x97:531x451/960x640/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":960},{"height":853,"key":"xxlarge","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/tc7cs-9ReshOaQjlp6fj4Um6WIk=/0x97:531x451/1280x853/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":1280}]}],"sections":[{"name can teach us about our place in the universe","label":null},"relativeUrl":"/opinion/comment/bina-venkataraman-solar-eclipse-can-teach-us-about-our-place-in-the-universe/a113645104.html","webcmsId":"A113645104","articleType":"article","title":"Bina Venkataraman: Solar eclipse can teach us about our place in the universe","subLabel":"","premium":true,"intro":[{"p":"Returning to Wooster, my hometown of 27,000 people in north-eastern Ohio, is usually an occasion not to worry about street parking or dinner reservations. opinion","label":null},"relativeUrl":"/opinion/comment/ian-odoherty-if-hate-speech-bill-becomes-law-well-all-end-up-in-court-for-voicing-our-opinion/a579299552.html","webcmsId":"A579299552","articleType":"article","title":"Ian O’Doherty: If hate-speech bill becomes law, we’ll all end up in court for voicing our opinion","subLabel":"","premium":true,"intro":[{"p":"Monday was April Fool’s Day, when people traditionally play pranks on each other. It’s a rather archaic tradition. When was the last time someone tried to prank you? I exclude the people of Scotland from that question. They suffer under the soft tyranny of the SNP and their even more unfathomable coalition partners, the Scottish Green Party. Monday symbolised perhaps the greatest prank any government has ever played on its own people. It has now ratified the insane hate-crime act, which will see anyone accused of “hate speech” – by anyone who doesn’t like hearing opinions that differ from their own – facing the prospect of prosecution by the Scottish police. Under this legislation, anyone who is accused of being “mean” or of “misgendering” a man who identifies as a woman can potentially end up in prison. Their lives and careers could be destroyed. It has inflamed controversy because some feminists, and those who believe biological facts hold a greater value than opinions, will be criminalised. This puts them on a collision course with transgender people, who generally use labels for their gender rather than their assigned sex at birth. Scotland’s first minister Humza Yousaf has claimed, in its defence, that the new law would deal with a “rising tide of hatred”. He says anybody who makes a vexatious complaint or one without merit can also be tackled by the police. JK Rowling waged a long battle against the hate-crime bill. She has crusaded against what she sees as tyrannical new structures against freedom of expression. Rowling has argued that “freedom of speech and belief” would be at an end if what she sees as accurate descriptions of biological sex were outlawed. She has now openly challenged Scottish police to arrest her under the new act after writing a series of posts on social media calling some trans women men."}],"images":[{"url":"https://s3.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","id":"IMG:520bffee","sourceSets":[{"height":80,"key":"xsmall","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/WQ-vfdXdAe-BVsXIj5xPHgJX8oI=/0x97:531x451/120x80/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":120},{"height":107,"key":"small","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/YEdliDJUro4UPvkMk56LXaVcGio=/0x97:531x451/160x107/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":160},{"height":160,"key":"smallMobile","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/CA6Y3_WC5p7lE_p9cUKulRZhj7k=/0x97:531x451/240x160/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":240},{"height":213,"key":"medium","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/BH3bBHfbDn_DOJ_CFpIL0O2MrYs=/0x97:531x451/320x213/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":320},{"height":427,"key":"large","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/O1GyDMD5iPtO8Bp6133URBppuvE=/0x97:531x451/640x427/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":640},{"height":640,"key":"xlarge","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/6NWg7eOu_E_2pGyfEJO4ripnkSo=/0x97:531x451/960x640/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":960},{"height":853,"key":"xxlarge","url":"https://focus.independent.ie/thumbor/tc7cs-9ReshOaQjlp6fj4Um6WIk=/0x97:531x451/1280x853/prod-mh-ireland/b29586cf-37d4-4a7b-9892-7ab60f8ddae2/a1b41ff9-c798-41a2-9cb2-2f8bd5c1be03/51Fantastic%20Beasts.jpg","width":1280}]}],"sections":[{"name <!-- end block ' section-6-9' -->
        </div>    </div>    <div class="grid__col size-1-2--bp4 size-1-4--bp5">        <div class="grid__col__inner"><!-- start block ' section-6-10' -->
